intro: Lampranthus proximus, commonly known as the firecracker flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often resembling firecrackers, hence its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing succulent leaves adapted for water storage. Lampranthus proximus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom profusely during the warmer months.
